instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro Works, No Fan!
threads.message:
I got an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> in that had a fan flex cable with a break in it. Simple enough repair, order a new fan, etc. Still no fan on power up however fan works in another MacBook. After testing the fan socket there is no data coming from <SIGNAL>SMC_FAN_RT_PWM</SIGNAL>.

Voltage Readings:

Pin 1: 5.01 V
Pin 2: 0.004 V
Pin 3: 0 V
Pin 4: 3.34 V
Pin 5: 0 V

<RESISTOR>R6061</RESISTOR> is 99.9 K Ohm

<TRANSISTOR>Q6060</TRANSISTOR> has 3.30 V on Pin 1, 0.004 V on Pin 2, 0.004 V Pin 3.

Possibly an SMC issue?

threads.title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro Works, No Fan!
threads.message:
Could be the SMC yes, especially since there is 5V running next to the signal

Not sure if this model only activated the fan after it reached a certain temprature though, Checked with ASD?

threads.title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro Works, No Fan!
threads.message: I have not run ASD on it, I have it propped up with a fan blowing on it to keep cool. Will this model <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> EMC 2835 work with ASD 3S155?

threads.title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro Works, No Fan!
threads.message:
It would help if we knew what board number this was.

2015 models with 4924 boards the fan only starts when the system gets hot.

threads.title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro Works, No Fan!
threads.message: Its an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. I will let the computer sit and warm up to see if the fan gets triggered.

threads.title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro Works, No Fan!
threads.message: Just boot up holding the "D" and it will run diagnostic and run the fan.

threads.title: [SOLVED]MacBook Pro Works, No Fan!
threads.message: This post can be marked as solved it worked properly when running diags :)
